Comment: To be ready, 'ohi gaa'teeʔ; 'ohi ihi gaa'teeʔ. To be ready for, 'ohi ihi gaa'tee omeʔ.
To be ready, 'ohi gaa'teeʔ; 'ohi ihi gaa'teeʔ. To be ready for, 'ohi ihi gaa'tee omeʔ.
Also kukara-'ni; kukara-'ne; means a rock 01.440.
Also kukara-'ni; kukara-'ne; means a rock 01.440.
Also taniŋii-a. Tobité dialect is taniŋii-e.
Also taniŋii-a. Tobité dialect is taniŋii-e.
Latter is reflexive. Also oo ye'don̥a-riŋeei.
Latter is reflexive. Also oo ye'don̥a-riŋeei.
Refer to a person. An 'old thing' is i'haroo-i; i'haroo; 'kučaa-i'haroo-i; 'kučaa-i'haroo.
Refer to a person. An 'old thing' is i'haroo-i; i'haroo; 'kučaa-i'haroo-i; 'kučaa-i'haroo.
Refer to a person. An 'old thing' is i'haroo-i; i'haroo; 'kučaa-i'haroo-i; 'kučaa-i'haroo.
Latter means 'small piece', 08.470, 12.560. A piece of cloth is bo'raa-peei; piece of fiber, da'hu-peei; piece of iron, ge'beeke-peei 09.670.
Latter means 'small piece', 08.470, 12.560. A piece of cloth is bo'raa-peei; piece of fiber, da'hu-peei; piece of iron, ge'beeke-peei 09.670.
Also ĩre'tãa-i; ĩre'tã; and gee'n̥aa-i; geen̥a-'ŋe. 'To be full' is i'raguʔ; gee'n̥aʔ 13.104.
Also ĩre'tãa-i; ĩre'tã; and gee'n̥aa-i; geen̥a-'ŋe. 'To be full' is i'raguʔ; gee'n̥aʔ 13.104.
Also 'abundant, excessive', po'ro-n̥a-i; po'ro-n̥a; and 'taa-di; 'taa-de; hi'e-i; hi'e, 'abundant'. Also occurring: uhu'ya-i; uhu'ya; oko-i; oko; o'rone-i; orone; pi'e-i; pi'e.
Also 'abundant, excessive', po'ro-n̥a-i; po'ro-n̥a; and 'taa-di; 'taa-de; hi'e-i; hi'e, 'abundant'. Also occurring: uhu'ya-i; uhu'ya; oko-i; oko; o'rone-i; orone; pi'e-i; pi'e.
Means 'it finishes Ayores which finish my hand'; and čee'n̥a ayo're čee'n̥a yim̥a'naa; gee'n̥a-nie ayo're čee'n̥a yim̥anaa-y, meaning 'is filled Ayores which finish my hand'.

Means 'it finishes me'. Also čee'n̥a ayo're čo'm̥ara-i, 'it finishes one Ayoré (person)'; and čee'n̥a ayo're čo'm̥ara; čeen̥a ayo're čo'mara-neʔ; čeen̥a ayo're čo'm̥ara-nieʔ. Also čeen̥a yi'ridaa-yodeʔ; čeen̥a yi'ridaa-dieʔ, 'it finishes my feet'. Also possible, gee'n̥a ayo're čo'm̥araʔ, lit. 'is filled-Ayoré-one'.
Means 'it finishes my (right) foot'; and čee'n̥a yi'ridaa-i čo'm̥ara-i; čee'n̥a yi'ridaa-i čo'm̥ara; čee'n̥a yi'ridaa-i čo'm̥ara-neʔ; čeen̥a yi'ridaa-i čo'm̥ara-nieʔ.
Means 'two on my (right) foot'; and 'gare ihi yi'ridaa-ya; 'gare ihi yi'ridaa-deʔ; 'gare ihi yi'ridaa-yodeʔ; 'gare ihi yi'ridaa-dieʔ.
Means 'one on my right foot'; and čo'm̥ara ihi yi'ridaa-ya; čo'm̥ara ihi yi'ridaa-deʔ; čo'm̥ara ihi yi'ridaa-dieʔ.
Means 'it finishes my hands'. Also čee'n̥a yim̥a'naa-i-nieʔ.

Means 'four on my hand-other'; and ga'gan̥i ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa-i; ga'gan̥i ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa-neʔ; ga'gan̥i ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa-nieʔ. Also, with gesture, ga'gan̥i ihi ti, (show all but the little finger on left hand); and ga'gan̥i ihi 'ti-a; ga'gan̥i ihi 'ti-odeʔ; ga'gan̥i ihi 'ti-dieʔ.

Means 'three on my hand-other'; and gadi'og ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa-i; gadi'og ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa-neʔ; gadi'og ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa-nieʔ. Also, with gesture, gadi'og ihi ti (showing thumb, index finger, and middle finger on left hand); and gadi'og ihi 'ti-a; gadi'og ihi 'ti-odeʔ; gadi'og ihi 'ti-dieʔ.

Means 'two on my hand-other'; and 'gare ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa; 'gare ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa-neʔ; 'gare ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa-nieʔ. Also, with gesture, 'gare ihi ti, (showing the thumb and index finger of left hand); and 'gare ihi 'ti-a; 'gare ihi 'ti-odeʔ; 'gare ihi 'ti-dieʔ.

Means 'one on my hand-other'; and čo'm̥ara ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa; čo'm̥ara ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa-neʔ; čo'm̥ara ihi yim̥a'n-uɲaa-nieʔ. Also, with gesture, čo'm̥ara ihi ti, 'one on here' (indicating/showing the thumb on left hand); and čo'm̥ara ihi 'ti-a; čo'm̥ara ihi 'ti-odeʔ; čo'm̥ara ihi 'ti-dieʔ.
Means 'it finishes my hand'. Also čee'n̥a yim̥a'naa; čee'n̥a yim̥a'naa-neʔ; čee'n̥a yim̥a'naa-nieʔ.
First form is verb. Also ga'gan̥i-oneʔ; ga'gan̥i-nieʔ.
First form is verb. Also ga'gan̥i-oneʔ; ga'gan̥i-nieʔ.
First form is verb. Also ga'gan̥i-oneʔ; ga'gan̥i-nieʔ.
Respectively: verb; adj.; adj. Also gadi'o-godeʔ; gadi'o-ge-dieʔ.
Respectively: verb; adj.; adj. Also gadi'o-godeʔ; gadi'o-ge-dieʔ.
Respectively: verb; adj.; adj. Also gadi'o-godeʔ; gadi'o-ge-dieʔ.
Also čo'm̥ara-i, indicated by the thumb on the right hand.
To change oneself, i'ɲoɲa eŋa; i'ɲoɲa-hiʔ.
Respectively: lit. 'eye' 04.210, e.g. in cloth, metal, etc.; means 'a hole in the ground (with narrow mouth, like a well)'; 'with wide mouth (like a ditch)'.
Respectively: lit. 'eye' 04.210, e.g. in cloth, metal, etc.; means 'a hole in the ground (with narrow mouth, like a well)'; 'with wide mouth (like a ditch)'.
Respectively: lit. 'eye' 04.210, e.g. in cloth, metal, etc.; means 'a hole in the ground (with narrow mouth, like a well)'; 'with wide mouth (like a ditch)'.
See 07.250. 'Round and thick' is tutu'tude-i; tutu'tudi; tutu'tude 12.630.
See 07.250. 'Round and thick' is tutu'tude-i; tutu'tudi; tutu'tude 12.630.
Refers to object such as a pan or tin. A flat table or board is ti'ro-i; tiro-'ge.
Refers to object such as a pan or tin. A flat table or board is ti'ro-i; tiro-'ge.
Refers to a person. Also ki'yigitaa-i; ki'yigitaa-ge 05.123 'ripe'.
Refers to a person. Also ki'yigitaa-i; ki'yigitaa-ge 05.123 'ripe'.
Also naɲoo'raa-i; naɲoo'ree. 'Thick and round (like a squash or stick)', tutu'tude-i; tutu'tudi; tutu'tude 12.810.
Also naɲoo'raa-i; naɲoo'ree. 'Thick and round (like a squash or stick)', tutu'tude-i; tutu'tudi; tutu'tude 12.810.
Also a'haami-ŋom̥a-i; a'haami-ŋom̥a, 'not narrow', lit. 'narrow-negative'. Also čã'aa-i; čã'aa.
Also a'haami-ŋom̥a-i; a'haami-ŋom̥a, 'not narrow', lit. 'narrow-negative'. Also čã'aa-i; čã'aa.
See 07.250. Also pahoga-'di; pahoga'de; and 'short but strong' tu'nu-i; tunu-'ŋe.
See 07.250. Also pahoga-'di; pahoga'de; and 'short but strong' tu'nu-i; tunu-'ŋe.
Means where the sun comes out.
Noun forms. To cover with leaves, aa'ko-gaay; to cover with dirt, iko'sa-gaay.
Noun forms. To cover with leaves, aa'ko-gaay; to cover with dirt, iko'sa-gaay.
Also e'dogesaa-i; e'dogesaa-ge; verbal form is u'čere-ŋaay.
Also e'dogesaa-i; e'dogesaa-ge; verbal form is u'čere-ŋaay.
The remains, in the pot, ubuti.
The remains, in the pot, ubuti.
Also means 'put in'. To put in, over, or in its place, 'iča-haʔ; to put in its place, i'man-ahaʔ; to put up ugu'eseʔ.
Also means 'put in'. To put in, over, or in its place, 'iča-haʔ; to put in its place, i'man-ahaʔ; to put up ugu'eseʔ.
Refer to position. See 04.331. Reference to motion, ahaʔ; tahaʔ; -ahaʔ; -jaʔ.
Refer to position. See 04.331. Reference to motion, ahaʔ; tahaʔ; -ahaʔ; -jaʔ.
Refer to position. See 04.331. Reference to motion, ahaʔ; tahaʔ; -ahaʔ; -jaʔ.
Refer to position. See 04.331. Reference to motion, ahaʔ; tahaʔ; -ahaʔ; -jaʔ.
Refer to position. See 04.331. Reference to motion, ahaʔ; tahaʔ; -ahaʔ; -jaʔ.
See 'body' 04.110, which forms a minimal pair with the above.
See 'body' 04.110, which forms a minimal pair with the above.
Means 'house of the things' 07.120, 09.430. Also oo're-die i'gi-n̥aai, means 'trade house' 11.870.
Means the center of the village 19.160, 12.370.
Also 'erã-ha-to; oo're-die gai-'soorĩ; oo're-die gai-'to; oo're-die ga'soorĩ, T. dialect.
Also 'erã-ha-to; oo're-die gai-'soorĩ; oo're-die gai-'to; oo're-die ga'soorĩ, T. dialect.
Also ipotiga'ke-daate-ŋoo'ri; ipotiga'ke-daate-'to, means 'one who has strong desires'. Also ka'niiraa-ŋom̥a-i; ka'niiraa-gom̥a, means 'not generous'; ka'niiro-m̥a-i; ka'niiro-m̥a, 'not generous'.
Mean 'he who begs'; also u'tai-to, 'she who begs' 18.350. Also u'tai-'de-bee-i; u'tai-'de-bee 'he who begs all the time'. Also possible, u'tai-soori-daa'te-i; u'tai-ŋoori-daa'te-i; u'tai-to-daa'te.
Mean 'he who begs'; also u'tai-to, 'she who begs' 18.350. Also u'tai-'de-bee-i; u'tai-'de-bee 'he who begs all the time'. Also possible, u'tai-soori-daa'te-i; u'tai-ŋoori-daa'te-i; u'tai-to-daa'te.
Means 'with many things'. Also maata-'gom̥a-i; maata-'gom̥a, means 'not poor'; u'guča-n̥a-i; u'guča-n̥a, means 'very rich'.
Means 'with many things'. Also maata-'gom̥a-i; maata-'gom̥a, means 'not poor'; u'guča-n̥a-i; u'guča-n̥a, means 'very rich'.
The latter means to lose oneself.
The latter means to lose oneself.
The latter means 'to pull down'. Also i'noniŋaseʔ 'to weaken'.
The latter means 'to pull down'. Also i'noniŋaseʔ 'to weaken'.
Also u'huuse gi'o, 'the captain looks after his people'.
Also u'huuse gi'o, 'the captain looks after his people'.
Mean 'he that gets'; also gii'yakeʔ; giiya-'to.
Mean 'he that gets'; also gii'yakeʔ; giiya-'to.
Means: grasp quickly. Also ido'ta, grasp tightly.
Also oo gaan̥ee'ŋi-hiʔ, means 'to make one's own'.
Can be expressed as iise yoote ke'de-n̥a e'do-gaay, 12.353, means 'reach the edge of the shore' 01.270.
The latter is an animal path. A 'cart trail' is yu'pidi.
The latter is an animal path. A 'cart trail' is yu'pidi.
The former means to make fall.
The former means to make fall.
See 06.110. To enter in the water, a'huke yoo'di, means 'split the water'.
The latter is to arrive late.
The latter is to arrive late.
Means to follow a track. To f. a leader, aa'yo-hi ki'gaadeʔ 10.460, 12.011.
To get out of work, (and therefore 'depart') is ã'ra yu i'hiʔ 'to go fast'.

Is used in combination, 'to go for...', as in 10.350. To go to a thing or place, i'ka-hiʔ 10.474; to go to a person, i'bagi 10.480; to go in a group, i'kiin̥-oŋ-ahaʔ; to go direct, go fast, oo ka'ru; oo ka'ru-haʔ; go to one side, oo 'ɲ̥uukeʔ. The word 'go' has two possibilities, which can be expressed in Spanish as: irse; ir para traer.These are conjugated differently. Prepositions may be suffixed to some verbs: ihiʔ / ahaʔ.
To run carrying something is aayo 'udi, lit. 'to run under'; to run to assault, ukugu'n̥a-hiʔ.
The latter two mean 'to walk to'. 'To walk in' is ĩiri'gi-hiʔ 10.660; to walk with shoes on, is uu'čie 'yiriidaa-deʔ 06.510, 10.431; to walk barefoot is uu'čie n̥u'mi 01.212, 10.431.
The latter two mean 'to walk to'. 'To walk in' is ĩiri'gi-hiʔ 10.660; to walk with shoes on, is uu'čie 'yiriidaa-deʔ 06.510, 10.431; to walk barefoot is uu'čie n̥u'mi 01.212, 10.431.
The latter two mean 'to walk to'. 'To walk in' is ĩiri'gi-hiʔ 10.660; to walk with shoes on, is uu'čie 'yiriidaa-deʔ 06.510, 10.431; to walk barefoot is uu'čie n̥u'mi 01.212, 10.431.
The latter is to kick hard.
The latter is to kick hard.
To jump with joy is ẽ'raču-omeʔ.
To jump with joy is ẽ'raču-omeʔ.
This verb is used for 'to abort', yi'ka karu'n̥a-hi yu, means 'my womb slipped in me' 04.470.
This verb is used for 'to abort', yi'ka karu'n̥a-hi yu, means 'my womb slipped in me' 04.470.
See 05.560. Also ĩiri'gi-hi yoo'di gaay 10.470; the sound of one swimming is čo tũ tũ.
Also iiti'ŋaareʔ; to throw with force is een̥a-'pusu.
Also iiti'ŋaareʔ; to throw with force is een̥a-'pusu.
Means to stumble, fall. To fall inside is ĩi'koorã-haʔ. To fall from above is i'baaseʔ.
Also means 'wake up' 04.630. Also 'rise from sitting' is i'yageʔ; to rise rapidly is i'yage-m̥ameʔ.
To twist garabatá fiber (for thread) is u'kareʔ 06.380.
Also means to be born 04.720. To let drop is iramu'raaseʔ 17.320, 10.473; to d. on top of, is ibaa'sa-haʔ; to d. in front of, is ibaas-'aha i'keei.
To turn something over is oo'rehi gaa'teeʔ; oo're-i gaa'teeʔ.

Used with the word telling where. To move back and forth is uŋu'raseʔ; to move oneself is iho'kaaseʔ yu 05.540, 10.650; to move agitatedly is ike'n̥aʔ; to m. oneself from one side to the other is oo're-hiʔ 10.220.
Means to paint a house 18.510. To p. face with lines is uru'ruʔ; to p. the body with honey and put the down of birds on it, is u'ruu aa'si; to p. oneself with soot is ipori'gas-ahaʔ.
Refers to a long chisel. Also ge'beei, an Ayoré chisel; 09.670, 09.250, 10.750.
Respectively: fruit used for blue paint; urucum used for red paint.
Respectively: fruit used for blue paint; urucum used for red paint.
Means b. of rope; a b. of palm fronds is o'rai in̥aak o'ho.
Respectively: a thing of glass 06.960; necklace of g. 06.750.
Respectively: a thing of glass 06.960; necklace of g. 06.750.
Can also refer to any metal. See 09.250; 09.840; 10.750.
To bore an ear or belt is i'n̥ireʔ.
Respectively: to s. inside; to s. outside.
Respectively: to s. inside; to s. outside.
The latter is 'squeeze the body'. Also imi'neseʔ. 'To wring again' is ipaati'gaseʔ; 'to w. a hyssop of honey' is i'hoseʔ.
The latter is 'squeeze the body'. Also imi'neseʔ. 'To wring again' is ipaati'gaseʔ; 'to w. a hyssop of honey' is i'hoseʔ.
Respectively: same as 'wound' 04.850; 'slip knot'. A 'knot in a bow' is či'e-riŋai; či'e-riŋeei.
Respectively: same as 'wound' 04.850; 'slip knot'. A 'knot in a bow' is či'e-riŋai; či'e-riŋeei.
The latter is 'braided rope'. 'Lasso' is 'enuhe-n̥ai; 'feather rope' is ibota'ye.
The latter is 'braided rope'. 'Lasso' is 'enuhe-n̥ai; 'feather rope' is ibota'ye.
'To tie up an animal' is a'di-haʔ.
Means 'grasp my surroundings'; cf. 15.710, 11.140. 'Hard work' is un̥u'si yu 'omeʔ, means 'feel very comfortable with'; 'to w. with eagerness' is oo yuhu'ɲa-meʔ, means 'to punish myself' 21.370.
Edible m. is hupa-'ŋoori, in the N̥upedo Goosodeʔ dialect.
Means 'different corn plant'; sugar cane plant is n̥aaka'raai, cf. 08. 510.
Very thin b. is 'n̥aakaraake pa'ri, means 'grass that is closed'; thin b. for flute is i'n̥irooi; thick b. for house building is i'n̥i'roke pa'ri.
'unoro is a water plant with leaves like the banana leaves.
Also bahu'tasi; baru'tasi, latter used for houses. A vine used for killing fish is ere'nai.
A small f.; also 'kuča-a'sige; a large f. is po'n̥aa-ŋe, means 'blown up'.
A tap root is ee'ri-keruui, cf. 12.550. Other roots that entwine are ee'ri; r. of fallen tree is 'kuč-ee'ri.
From Span. 'arroz'. Rice in the husk is ã'oraai; r. plant is n̥aaka'raai, cf. 08.510; r. chaff is u'ru-i, cf. 05.550.

Refers to hard c., 15.740. Sweet c. is edo pa'rataai, 15.750; yellow sweet c. is edo 'sarẽ-i 15.690; popcorn is 'geen̥a-pitai 12.560; blue c. is ugare-'tei; c. on the cob is 'geen̥a u'po-i, 15.680; shelled c. is geen̥a'ɲ̥u-nieʔ; 'geen̥a-pina'su-i; sparce c. on the cob is geen̥a'ɲ̥u-nie 'tigi 'tigi. A c. plant is gee'n̥ai; dried c. plant is itabi-'di, which also means 'feather shaft'.

Refers to hard c., 15.740. Sweet c. is edo pa'rataai, 15.750; yellow sweet c. is edo 'sarẽ-i 15.690; popcorn is 'geen̥a-pitai 12.560; blue c. is ugare-'tei; c. on the cob is 'geen̥a u'po-i, 15.680; shelled c. is geen̥a'ɲ̥u-nieʔ; 'geen̥a-pina'su-i; sparce c. on the cob is geen̥a'ɲ̥u-nie 'tigi 'tigi. A c. plant is gee'n̥ai; dried c. plant is itabi-'di, which also means 'feather shaft'.
To r. by breaking is i'bero-haʔ 09.260.
Refers to a metal s. A wooden s., which the oldtimers used, is kora'ŋaraaŋe.
Also i'hooča-gaay; d. to bury is ihoo'ča-meʔ.
Tobité dialect is tu're-n̥ai. Also n̥upe pero-ri'ŋai 08.410, lit. breaking of the earth.
Lit, 'puncture, pierce + earth' 0l.212. Also i'n̥o-ŋaay, cf. 09.222.
The central post of an Ayoré house, which is round, is ku'tate-daate-i.
'ooho also means crest of a mountain.
Means a scar made by fire, 04.858. Also piio-'ge-n̥ai, can refer to electric light bulb. Also iɲ̥a'ne, a torch, burning branch.
Also means head of the bed.
To make the b. is ĩ'tereʔ. To make his own bed or position of sleeping is oo y-ihoga-'di, cf. 07.210.
Also means origen (smoke), came out, thrown out.
A bed of fire is n̥upu-'yu-riŋai, means 'cooked earth'.
Lit. the 'house's eye'. Also pia'goi; pia'go kata'dei, cf. 12.590, 12.810.
Also means 'place/habitation' 12.110. Cf. 07.420. Also hoga-pii, room where one lives, or cupboard, closet.
Lit. 'opening', as, e.g., the opening of a boil. Also 'hori-de; gi'gi-n̥aai 'hori-de, 'covering of the empty space'. The sound of a door opening is čoo 'beebe.
See 09.740. A big mirror is a'hiikara'ne-n̥ai.
Lit. 'clothes' (?); 06.120, 09.422. 'Face soap (sweet smelling soap)' is [habón] u'neri, from Span. 'jabón'.
Refers to big, black seed-beads; small black seed-beads is pu'ru-i.

A n. made of hair is dak-aa'terero; n. of hair with a shell is ore-pi'tai; n. of shell is o'ri; n. of a broken gourd is tororo-'peei; n. of big, black seeds is 'araguu-dieʔ; n. of little black seeds is puru-'godeʔ; n. of glass is 'araɲ̥ua; n. of big pieces of glass is yo'de.

A n. made of hair is dak-aa'terero; n. of hair with a shell is ore-pi'tai; n. of shell is o'ri; n. of a broken gourd is tororo-'peei; n. of big, black seeds is 'araguu-dieʔ; n. of little black seeds is puru-'godeʔ; n. of glass is 'araɲ̥ua; n. of big pieces of glass is yo'de.
Refers to b. of thread used by Ayoré women; b. of thread used by Ayoré men, igaru'b-odeʔ. Belt used by captains is paa'mo.
Ayoré men's thread, 02.280 is 'diyeke. Ayoré women's thread is diyoki, 02.280. Garabatá t. is dukari (see 10.170); sewing t. is n̥a'tua, 06.240.

To s. with haste is aa'koseʔ; s. with large stitches is in̥a'mi; s. fast with large stitches is aa'čera-ha ke'den̥-aneʔ. Make an appliqué is u'gaa-gaay; s. with another color thread is i'ŋirã n̥a'tua tahaʔ 09.211.
Same as 'clothing' 06.120. A piece of cloth is bo'raa-peei 06.950, 13.230. 'Mosquito net' (fine white cloth), is heesabe-'n̥a. Also ugaa-'ŋoori; ugaa-'to.
Also aa'ka-ha igi'de 10.570. To wear attractive clothes is udu'n̥ui-ŋaay.
Also 'kučaa kũ'reei 05.510. Egg shell is 'kučaa-kũ'reei a'ooi 04.120; egg white is uka'gooi.

Refers to mother's milk. Cf. other liquids, such as 'oil' 05.790. Cow's m. is ka'baayudie iri's-odeʔ 03.230; with much m. is iri'si-rẽe; with little m. is iri'so-m̥a; iri'to-m̥a, the latter is Tobité dialect.

Domestic bee h. is a'ka 08.530; a cell of wild h. is du'kuu-pie; abundance of h. is ku'terĩ-'pepie; h. brought to camp is i'saa-i 11.140; h. guarded is hoo'yaa-i; wasp h. is 'asago; tree in which they hope will yield h. is 'tode; h. water kũ'ter-ota'di, lit. h. liquid, cf. 'beverage' 05.900, 'soup' 05.640. Also h. 'de sombresucha' (a wild bee) iča'tui; a'yoi (a black bee); a'yo ahi'di 06.780; wild h., similar to domestic h. is n̥u'taya.

Ground s. is e'čo u'rui, lit. salt dust; cf. 'flour' 05.550. A chunk of s. is e'čo-i i'ribi-di; to sprinkle s. on the food u'n̥ute-gaay; s. crystals ũri'arõi ga'n̥ui, lit. a picture of molartooth 04.272.
Lit. 'seed' 08.311. A palm nut is či'ekeči'eŋe.

Also ku'gee ča'ki-peei; white b. is kugee ke'de-n̥ai; short b. is ku'gee-pitai, lit. a small bean; lima b. 'koyabe-n̥ai; vine b. is ku'gee-i ba'haai, lit. first b.; ku'gee-i ne'haai; ku'gee-i du'guu-taai 10.472, a climbing vine.
Meat flour is ã'rii; m. roasted on the coals is ago'taa-i; m. that has little blood iboo'r-i; iboo'r-e.
The sound of grinding is čoo tũ tũ 10.350.
Also means 'dust' 01.213; also rice hull, 05.810. 'Palm nut flour' is nami-'ni; wheat or manioc f. is 'kučaa u'rui; fine corn f. is ti'ki-n̥ai.
Also kũ'reei, in the Guidaay Goosode dialect. Cf. 05.970.
Also imeer-'ihiʔ. To s. by beating is uŋu'ras-ihiʔ.
Also imeer-'ihiʔ. To s. by beating is uŋu'ras-ihiʔ.
To. s. a pot, gourd, or clear the ground. To s. pot and for sexual sense a'muna; u'muna, cf. 'suck' 05.160. To s. garabatá leaves for the fiber i'ŋaruã; iŋa'ŋura.
Also in̥i'ŋeɲomee. One who uses the s. is in̥iŋeya-'soorĩ; -'ŋoori; -'to.
Means a kind of bird beak, 04.270. Also 'kučaa pã'taraake ga'n̥ui, 'like pliars'.
A k. in a sheath is ka'ričaai; kee'seei ka'ričaai 03.655.
Means to b. in a hole in the ground.

Means to roast manioc or squash under the coals or in the ashes. To r. meat over the coals is ago'taʔ; igo'taʔ; to r. corn, manioc, meat (with little blood) over the coals is i'booreʔ; to r. turtle or pig in the fire 'iča-haʔ; r. on a wooden grill (meat or fish) oo yãasera'no-meʔ.

Means to roast manioc or squash under the coals or in the ashes. To r. meat over the coals is ago'taʔ; igo'taʔ; to r. corn, manioc, meat (with little blood) over the coals is i'booreʔ; to r. turtle or pig in the fire 'iča-haʔ; r. on a wooden grill (meat or fish) oo yãasera'no-meʔ.
To c. corn, manioc, beans alone or with meat.
Means almost choke. To c. while eating oo ka'rag-ahaʔ.
Also oo ti'rokeʔ; oo ti'rok; oo ti'rakeʔ; oo ti'rak. To s. without chewing i'nire-gaay; ti'rokeʔ.
Also means 'eat' 05.110. To chew for another is ũ'tirẽʔ; 'one who c. for another' is ũtira-'soorĩ; ũtira-'ŋoori; ũtira-'to.
Also means 'eat' 05.110. To chew for another is ũ'tirẽʔ; 'one who c. for another' is ũtira-'soorĩ; ũtira-'ŋoori; ũtira-'to.
Lit. 'nurse (suck milk). To s. honey or a liquid is i'peseʔ; u'muna (05.480); 'one that sucks much' is are'ko-n̥ai; are'ko-n̥a. See 'sexual intercourse' 04.670; 'prostitute' 19.720.
Cf. 'famine' 05.141. To be very hungry is čagu'ei či'hooča yu, lit. 'h. begs me'. Also čagu'ei čeẽ'n̥a yu, 14.270. Hungry to eat something special is siiro'bi.
'It is r.' tara'taʔ. 'To be r.' pu'n̥ui; pu'n̥ua 04.441; verbal form is oo pu'n̥uik.
'It is r.' tara'taʔ. 'To be r.' pu'n̥ui; pu'n̥ua 04.441; verbal form is oo pu'n̥uik.

Refers to fruits and corn; squash is 'haro; fruits and watermelon o'hoi; o'ho, lit. tender. A fruit used for blue dye ku'yai; ku'ya, lit. bluish. 'Not ripe' is timaaču-'gom̥ai; timaaču-'gom̥a; very green is u'kata-gom̥ai; u'kata-gom̥a; beans, a tree, beehive, banana uri'ẽi; uri'eŋe 14.130. 'It is g.' ũri'eʔ.

Refers to fruits and corn; squash is 'haro; fruits and watermelon o'hoi; o'ho, lit. tender. A fruit used for blue dye ku'yai; ku'ya, lit. bluish. 'Not ripe' is timaaču-'gom̥ai; timaaču-'gom̥a; very green is u'kata-gom̥ai; u'kata-gom̥a; beans, a tree, beehive, banana uri'ẽi; uri'eŋe 14.130. 'It is g.' ũri'eʔ.

Refers to fruits and nuts, 15.690; also tu'hua. Ripe grain is u'ču-i; u'ču-a 15.740; rice, watermelon, some fruits, timaa'čui; timaaču'ge. 'It is ripe' ti'maateʔ; 'very ripe' e'n̥umeei; e'n̥umee, 12.550. Ripe, but small is ki'yigitaai; ki'yigitaage 12.650.

Refers to fruits and nuts, 15.690; also tu'hua. Ripe grain is u'ču-i; u'ču-a 15.740; rice, watermelon, some fruits, timaa'čui; timaaču'ge. 'It is ripe' ti'maateʔ; 'very ripe' e'n̥umeei; e'n̥umee, 12.550. Ripe, but small is ki'yigitaai; ki'yigitaage 12.650.
Also u'ɲeŋamee; u'ɲu-ŋom̥ai and u'ɲu-ŋom̥a, lit. 'not cooked'. 'It is raw' ke yu'ekeʔ; ke yu'ek.
'Well-cooked' is de'ɲ̥uhai; de'ɲ̥uha (falling apart); paka'tahaai; paka'taha, cf. 15.750. To be cooked is ee yuʔ, 14.180.
'Well-cooked' is de'ɲ̥uhai; de'ɲ̥uha (falling apart); paka'tahaai; paka'taha, cf. 15.750. To be cooked is ee yuʔ, 14.180.
Also 'kučaa piboo's-odeʔ. A sack lunch is 'gaahurani; something to be eaten later is aahura'ni; the best food is oomi-'tigai; oomi-'tigeei, the 'best'.
Also means 'chew' 05.180. To eat without leaving any for somebody else is i'ŋara-meʔ; iŋa'ra-meʔ. To eat something tabu is a'gu gaai.
Also means 'chew' 05.180. To eat without leaving any for somebody else is i'ŋara-meʔ; iŋa'ra-meʔ. To eat something tabu is a'gu gaai.
Lit. 'place of, container'. Also means a male 02.230. Also čo'ki-bii; čo'ki-bie, fem. form.
Lit. 'place of, container'. Also means a male 02.230. Also čo'ki-bii; čo'ki-bie, fem. form.
Negative of 15.440. Also isooraa-'ŋo-m̥a; isoo'r-om̥ai; isoo'r-om̥a.
Also aŋoniŋi-te 'pare, lit. the ears closed or clogged.
Also i'beroo-i; i'bero, lit. 'the broken one'. 'Paralyzed' is kõro-'korõ-i; kõro-'korõ; 'deformed' is sĩĩ'rĩĩ; sĩĩ'rĩĩ-a.
Also i'beroo-i; i'bero, lit. 'the broken one'. 'Paralyzed' is kõro-'korõ-i; kõro-'korõ; 'deformed' is sĩĩ'rĩĩ; sĩĩ'rĩĩ-a.
Also ...'peesu yuhu're-dieʔ, lit. 'it makes my tiredness'.
Same as 'medicine' 04.880. Poison for fishing, from a tree, is kopii'ten̥a; from a vine is ere'n̥ai bisi'di, lit. 'the vine's poison'.
Lit. 'the thing, place finished'. Also imani-'pidi. A scar made by fire is aa'posi.
Also čoo 'tidi 'tidi; čoo 'tigi 'tigi. First form also means 'throb'.
Also geen̥aa-ri'ŋeei; 's. with much pain and itching' is 'ŋii-riŋai; 'ŋii-riŋeei.
The latter means 'a bad wound'. Also an̥a'ŋoo-ŋe.
The latter means 'a bad wound'. Also an̥a'ŋoo-ŋe.
Also ee'toge. Also taa'yaai; taa'yaage, 'strong, in good health'.
Lit. 'it is in the womb'. To be p. for a long time is hee'ke; 'near term' is i'karẽẽ, lit. 'the one with the big womb'.
To perspire from a fever is hũ'rua gaay; see 'body' 04.110.
Also giido'boke kata'de, lit 'back low/short/round' 04.190; giidoboo kata'de.
o'doi is a navel that sticks out.
Lit. 'breast mouth' 04.240. Also i'n̥a pia'goi, 'breast door' 07.220.
Of a bird. Wing of insect is ãra'ma.
Lit. 'hand's core/center'. Also m̥anaay a'heei, lit. the hand's inside'.
Respectively: all the arm, or from the elbow to the shoulder; forearm.
Respectively: all the arm, or from the elbow to the shoulder; forearm.
The portion in the middle. Near the eyebrows is e'noočaai; near the hairline is u'kurute.
Scattered brain of a dead person is taro'pičaai.
Cf. 20.240. Also giido'bok an̥o'keei, lit. 'back bone'.
Lit. hair of the beard. See 'chin' 04.209. Also abu'hu-odeʔ, 'mustache'. Also abu'raaye.
ãaka'rãai means 'long hair'; 'short hair' is gaa'tuui.
A tree frog is ugai'tei; koo'koi. Many varieties of toads: ŋii'amia; yoŋo'ŋo; pã'pã; 'karakaraai.
Also gan̥ooi. There are many kinds.
A poisonous s. is nasaa'miroi. Tobité dialect is asaa'rio. A black s. is u'gaa-gadooi, lit. 's. that goes'.

Black m. that flies night and day; cf. 03.586. Small m. that flies by night is i'n̥aro; large m. that flies at night is suede'hai; side-'n̥ai; a big m. is i'n̥aro ke'den̥a; m. that flies at dawn and at dusk is se'da-bia; sue'da-bia.
Also huu'tabe-n̥a, lit. 'fly-diminutive'. A fruit fly that gets in the eyes is čiiya'bi; cf. 03.592.

The b. prepared for use in a ball is di'rin̥e; b. from the hive and chewed is du'kuudaai; black b. of the 'golden bee' is ii'beye; black edible b. of the 'suro bee' is kũtere ke'de-n̥a-i. Black or red b. that is sticky is čaake'do; čaae'do. In the N̥upedo Goo'sodeʔ dialect it can be used as a 'shoepolish'.
'Black widow s. is i'moi-n̥a; s. that spins webs in trails is ke'nee-ŋe'tee.
'Large black ant (with painful bite)' [isula(?)] is dii'ti. 'Small brown ant (with painful bite)' is diiti ke'de-n̥ai. 'Umbrella ant' is ga'n̥oo.
Also ya'mee; ya'mee ke'den̥ai. 'Marimono' is 'ohoho ke'den̥ai; 'manechi' is 'ohohoi; 'ohoho ke'ruui. See 12.550.
Lives in a lake. A river eel is too'soi.
An edible stingray. Nonedible is 'dika-če'ke; cf. 03.130.
Long shell. A round shell is kariča'ke; oval shell is dookara'mee. Cf. knife in a sheath 05.380.
Also giidobooi; kuuku'huu-daa'te, augmentative -daa'te. Also kuuku'huu-dai-'n̥a-i.
Also digoro'ko-n̥ai; digoroko ke'de-n̥a-i; huusi'ei; uusi'ei.

Small green, yellow, red parrot. Small blue p. with yellow beak is sirooga-'bi-a; small red p. is tiiya-'bi, čii'ya-'bi; cf. 03.831; small green p. is suaka'ra; small yellow p. is suakara ke'de-n̥a; small green p. with blue tail, yellow beak and wings is 'yirĩyiria; large red p. is sua're-n̥a; small macaw is i'beɲ̥ua; yellow macaw is sua're-n̥a ka'ŋurãa (see 15.690); blue macaw with yellow breast is sua're-n̥a ke'de-n̥a.
Lives in the rocks. Also 'koboto. See 03.832.
A small bird. A large bird is ču'ŋuperĩ.
A nest above the ground. A nest on the ground is 'uubie.
Also n̥aa'ko-n̥a, domestic duck. A water duck is n̥aa'ko-yike; a small water duck is kučibohaa-i. kučaa is 'thing'.
Lit. 'big taracoé', a bird of the area.
Diminutive. Also ka'baaya-bia, and aki'ra-bi; aki'ra-bia.
Possibly borrowed from Span. 'caballo'. Also aki'rai.
Lit. 'house of the cows'. Also aki'ra-die i'gin̥ai.
Lit. 'one that cares for cows'. Also 'ayasa-die irodi-'soorĩ, 'one that cares for sheep'.
Also po'yo-i; cf. 'winter' 14.740. Widower looking for another wife is da'go-i.
Cf. 'live' 04.740. Also poyo-'ge. A widow looking for another husband is da'go.
Also diisi-'haade refers to one parent deceased. If both parents are deceased, eebee'daai; eebee'daa.
Male and female, respectively. The terms for brothers and sisters are also used.
Male and female, respectively. The terms for brothers and sisters are also used.
Is woman's sister's daughter and man's brother's daughter. abu'hia is woman's brother's daughter and man's sister's daughter.
Is woman's sister's son and man's brother's son. abu'hi is woman's brother's son and man's sister's son.
Within the family she is called 'ami-a.
Within the family he is called 'ami.
The youngest brother is uŋaroo-i; uŋa'roo-i.
Of a boy. The oldest brother is ũrehãai; ũre'hãai.
Of a boy. 'Of a girl' is da'haai.
Also amanaču'ge. With children is abeeču'ge.
See 02.230. Also ako'te-račui. With children is abee'čui. Cf. 02.390.
Also 'oohi uɲ'aa-ne 'gaariʔ, lit. 'drink each other's body' 05.130 + 04.110.
Male infant. Also diiye'ke, 'female'. In the family, kara-taai; kara-'tee.
Respectively: see 04.990 'naked'; see 'young man' 02.251; see 'married man' 02.380.
Respectively: see 04.990 'naked'; see 'young man' 02.251; see 'married man' 02.380.
Respectively: see 04.990 'naked'; see 'young man' 02.251; see 'married man' 02.380.
Also pii'oi oka'rai-dieʔ; and piiok-e'do, lit. 'flame seen afar off'. e'do is 'eye, hole' 04.210.
Also means 'picture, reflection'. Also pu'ru-di; pu'ru-de.
diire is a form of 'day' 14.410; -ŋeei suffix indicating class of abstract noun; varies with -gai.
Lit. 'up, above' 12.080. Also 'gee-ode 'ueečaai; gaa'tee-odeʔ. Lit 'the other side of the clouds'.
Cf. 'earth' 01.212. Also n̥umi čo ta ta ta ta, onomatopoeic form.
Varies with kukara'ni, which is larger.
Also e'ram-oneʔ, lit. 'woods far away'. Cf. 'world' 01.100.
See 'body' 04.110; means 'edge of the pool'. Cf. 'eyebrow' 04.212.
Also parari-'ŋee-oneʔ. In the singular means a 'low place'.
daa'te is 'mother', with the meaning of 'big'. Also oro'ko.
Means 'dry time'; and ee'sooi, 'dry time'. Also a'rere-daa'teʔ. Also e'rami po'yo-i 01.410. po'yo-i means 'widower' 02.770.
See 01.410, 04.830. Also erape pi'honi-ŋai; and pu'tani-ŋai 'time to plant'.
Also koni'nii-n̥ai; koni'niin̥a. 'Bright red' is gaa'tii; ga'tii-a.
Also koni'nii-n̥ai; koni'niin̥a. 'Bright red' is gaa'tii; ga'tii-a.
See 08.470. Also ua'ha-di; ua'ha-de 08.470; and u'ču-i; u'ču-a 05.123.
See 08.470. Also ua'ha-di; ua'ha-de 08.470; and u'ču-i; u'ču-a 05.123.
See 08.470. Also paka'tahaa-i; paka'taha 05.121; de'ɲ̥uha-i; de'ɲ̥uha 05.121; sẽre'raču-i; sẽre'raču-ge.
See 08.470. Also paka'tahaa-i; paka'taha 05.121; de'ɲ̥uha-i; de'ɲ̥uha 05.121; sẽre'raču-i; sẽre'raču-ge.
See 10.420, because it is smooth and slippery.
See 10.420, because it is smooth and slippery.
Also i'meenu-i; i'meenu-a; 'daača-n̥ai; 'daača-n̥a, with much mud.
Also i'meenu-i; i'meenu-a; 'daača-n̥ai; 'daača-n̥a, with much mud.
Mean 'not dirty'. Also ge'saa-i; gesaa-'ge, 'swept clean', 12.240, 13.220.
Mean 'not dirty'. Also ge'saa-i; gesaa-'ge, 'swept clean', 12.240, 13.220.
See 02.410, 02.420. Means lucky person—son/ daughter good.
See 02.410, 02.420. Means lucky person—son/ daughter good.
Respectively: to kiss on the mouth 04.240; to k. on the cheek 04.208, 05.110.
Respectively: to kiss on the mouth 04.240; to k. on the cheek 04.208, 05.110.
A sharp pain, ača'booi; 'birth pains' i'ka ta'gu ihiʔ, means 'womb eats-in'.
Also aheehũrua'ču-riŋai; su'maan̥i-ŋai; aan̥iŋaarati'gai; aan̥iŋaareti'geei; uru'ŋu-riŋai; uru'ŋu-riŋeei.
Also aheehũrua'ču-riŋai; su'maan̥i-ŋai; aan̥iŋaarati'gai; aan̥iŋaareti'geei; uru'ŋu-riŋai; uru'ŋu-riŋeei.
The latter is to hope anxiously.
The latter is to hope anxiously.
Also ka'nii-raai; ka'nii-ree, lit. 'generous'; oo'm-i, oo'me 'good temperament'.
Also ka'nii-raai; ka'nii-ree, lit. 'generous'; oo'm-i, oo'me 'good temperament'.
Respectively: mistake in thinking; m. in talking; m. in talking.
Respectively: mistake in thinking; m. in talking; m. in talking.
Respectively: mistake in thinking; m. in talking; m. in talking.
'Beautiful' to an Ayoré person: uka'noŋa goni'ŋa-i; uka'noŋa goni'ŋa, which means not only beauty of form, but of strength, and the ability to resist hunger.
'Beautiful' to an Ayoré person: uka'noŋa goni'ŋa-i; uka'noŋa goni'ŋa, which means not only beauty of form, but of strength, and the ability to resist hunger.
Also ipotiga'kee-daa'te. 'To be greedy' is i'potaa 16.620.
Also ipotiga'kee-daa'te. 'To be greedy' is i'potaa 16.620.
'It seems to me' is ome ya'hee-odeʔ 04.460.
Lit. 'man-thing-owner of knowledge'. Also iira'haa-sõo'ri; iira'haa-to; iirahaa'tai; iirahaa'tai; iirahaa'tee; iirahaa'tiga-daa'te, 'much wisdom'.
Exclamation, lit. 'stranger-you!' 19.550. Also yoka'oo ua, lit. 'ignorant you!'
Means 'remember teaching and do it' 17.310. edu'gata 'finish one's apprenticeship'.
Also n̥oo ihi ya'heei, means 'go from my inside' 04.460; iramu'raaseʔ 10.160, 10.473.
Used as phrase connectives. A noun connective is o're; an equal phrase connective is 'hekeʔ.
Used as phrase connectives. A noun connective is o're; an equal phrase connective is 'hekeʔ.
Used as phrase connectives. A noun connective is o're; an equal phrase connective is 'hekeʔ.
With raised eyebrows, a calling affirmative is 'hea; 'heeyee.
The latter is expressed with screwed up face.
The latter is expressed with screwed up face.
The latter refers to 'a little farther'.
The latter refers to 'a little farther'.
To use a whistle, is ipotiŋa'ra.
Means 'to explain/ tell his wrong doing'.
See 11.530, 11.690. Also dapa're; dapa'rei ask by actions, not words.
Means 'to talk-paper' 18.220, 18.560. Tobité dialect is ĩra'rãre aha gaay.
Lit. 'the people...'. Also e'dopasa-'soorĩ; e'dopasa-'ŋoori; e'dopasa-'to, means 'he/she who is of the totem'.
Means 'listen well' 15.420. Also i'peesu ahee-gai'do-de 'kučaa, means 'do-desires-things'; ihi uruu-'ode kii-'godeʔ, means 'do words directions' 18.260, 17.410.
To fight against, un̥u'si yu omeʔ.
Also a'heei serere-ti'gai; a'heei serere-ni'ŋai 04.460. Also ti'hoo-de čoo 'n̥ake; serere-ti'geei; ti'hoon̥aŋe-ri'ŋai.
Also a'heei serere-ti'gai; a'heei serere-ni'ŋai 04.460. Also ti'hoo-de čoo 'n̥ake; serere-ti'geei; ti'hoon̥aŋe-ri'ŋai.
A 'pistol' is po'kaa kata'de 12.590; 'rifle' is po'kaa; po'kaa garahaa-'dieʔ 02.458; 'shot-gun' is po'kaa ke'ruu-a 12.550.
Respectively: 'to defend oneself by speaking'; means 'I speak for my body'.
Respectively: 'to defend oneself by speaking'; means 'I speak for my body'.
A guard, during war, is pori'de; pori-'di; pori-'dei; in spite of the fem. ending, only men participate in war.
A guard, during war, is pori'de; pori-'di; pori-'dei; in spite of the fem. ending, only men participate in war.

Also ičahu-'to. Also possible, 'hočaa ičahu-'soorĩ; 'hočaa ičahu-'ŋoori; 'hočaa ičahu-'to; o'yid-ode ukue-'soori; o'yid-ode ukue-'ŋoori; o'yid-ode ukue-'to; o'yid-ode ake-'soori; o'yid-ode aku'e-to, means 'he/she who looks for fish' 03.650.

Also ičahu-'to. Also possible, 'hočaa ičahu-'soorĩ; 'hočaa ičahu-'ŋoori; 'hočaa ičahu-'to; o'yid-ode ukue-'soori; o'yid-ode ukue-'ŋoori; o'yid-ode ukue-'to; o'yid-ode ake-'soori; o'yid-ode aku'e-to, means 'he/she who looks for fish' 03.650.
A one-day hunt, is baai; 'baage; an overnight hunt is moo-i; moo-'ŋe 04.610.
A one-day hunt, is baai; 'baage; an overnight hunt is moo-i; moo-'ŋe 04.610.
A metal trap is ge'beeke noɲaa-ri'ŋeei.
A metal trap is ge'beeke noɲaa-ri'ŋeei.

Means 'do judgment'. Also a'hiire aa'd-ode aha kii-'godeʔ means 'see ways according to significance'. Also i'mate u'ɲane ipeesu'd-ode aha kii-'godeʔ, means 'finish other's deeds according to significance'.
Means 'I did thing-bad'. See 09.110, 09.440. Also 'ooriʔ, cf. 21.510.
Means 'adulterer', lit. 'wives-two'. Also a'bai-gare, lit. 'husband-two'; and a'gu-pii; a'gu-pie.
Also oo du'paa-de ihiʔ, means 'to make yourself a god'.
Lit. 'God's house'. Also Du'paa-de i'gin̥aa ku'čaa-bi, means 'God's house, big'.
Refers to a frame for drying fish, which is used.
The former, see 22.150. Also oo yu'ruu-haʔ, 21.240.
The former, see 22.150. Also oo yu'ruu-haʔ, 21.240.
Respectively: 12.080, 01.510, 12.470; plural form. Also gaa'tan̥o-keei; and 'gee-ode 'ueečaai, means 'the other side of the clouds'.
Respectively: 12.080, 01.510, 12.470; plural form. Also gaa'tan̥o-keei; and 'gee-ode 'ueečaai, means 'the other side of the clouds'.
Means 'thing prayed to'. Also ayo're-i ga'n̥u-i, 'Ayoré likeness'.
